Ik richt mij niet op direct gewin, maar de mogelijkheden op en aan de horizon. Ontwikkeling is fundamenteel voor mijn idee van waarde, authenticiteit is diens origine. Buiten de kaders denken is mijn norm.

Ik streef er altijd naar om de beste versie van mijzelf te worden, en daarin ook een inspiratie te zijn voor mijn omgeving. Ik ben een breed ontwikkeld, immer groeiend generalist, met specialistische kwaliteitseisen. Ik bouw een sterk, groot fundament voor vertrek. Ik heb ervaring in een uitgebreide diversiteit aan omgevingen (corporate, overheidswezen, commercie, cultuur, academie), domeinen (educatie, advies, verkoop, politiek, evenementen, e.a.) en posities (van de vloer, tot leidinggevend). Momenteel sta ik open voor advieszevende posities en projecten. Voel je vrij mij te benaderen om te kijken of mijn perspectief ook voor jou van waarde kan zijn!

name: Ton Hoenselaars
position 1: Professor of Early Modern English Literature and Culture
skills: ['English']
summary: Ton Hoenselaars is emeritus professor of Early Modern English Literature at the University of Utrecht. His research concentrates on early modern English literature (with a special focus on Shakespeare) and its international relations. He has published widely on images of nations in Renaissance literature, literature in translation, and on Shakespeare in European culture from 1600 to the present day. He is a member of the editorial board of Cahiers Elisabethains, Shakespeare Jahrbuch, and Shakespeare Survey. Hoenselaars is one of the editors of the Cambridge Guide to Shakespeare's Worlds (2016), and finishing a book on Shakespeare and World War I.

name: Bianca Pellet
skills: ['Academic Writing', 'Microsoft PowerPoint', 'Time Management', 'Communication', 'French to English', 'Web Content Creation', 'Search Engine Optimization (SEO)', 'HTML', 'English Literature', 'English Language', 'English as a Second Language (ESL)', 'Direct Sales', 'Aftersales', 'Order Processing', 'Organization Skills', 'Customer Service', 'Telephone Manner', 'Clerical Skills', 'Cash Handling', 'Blogging']
summary:
During my career I have worked with people from over 60 different countries, in France, the Netherlands and the UK; I have also trained and mentored new staff. I have worked in multiple industries as a freelancer, including translation (for major companies, such as Orange and Linklaters, as well as individual clients) and journalism (e.g. The London Magazine, Connexion France, TES, Metropolitan), including across time zones. These transferable skills from different sectors are valuable in my chosen career of teaching, enhancing my people skills and organisational abilities, and enabling me to show students how English language applies to the real world.

Having taught since 2008, I qualified as a secondary English teacher via an assessment-only route, obtaining qualified teacher status (QTS) in July 2014, before completing my NQT period in December 2020; this enabled me to become fully DUO-accredited in the Netherlands in February 2021. I am a dual national (British-French), further opening doors to EU-wide work. I have undergone yearly CPD across Europe since 2009, and implemented and taught IGCSE, MYP and IBDP programmes, as well as serving as Head of Y11 (2009-2017) and Y10-Y11 PSHE coordinator (2022-2023).

I have examined for CIE, OCR, the IBO, and Edexcel, and have produced bespoke educational materials for MarkMyPapers and Kognity, as well as writing a textbook - The A-Z of TOK - published by Elemi Education in October 2021.

Further, I have taught Anglophone students in Y6-9, and sixth-form American literature classes. I also have TA, cover teacher and learning support experience, as well as running a variety of extra-curricular activities. I regularly write and peer review for academic journals (e.g. The Use of English, English in Education) and have presented at conferences, such as those run by the English Language Schools Association. 

As a private tutor, I have supported a range of pupils, from postgraduate applied linguistics students to Classical Civilisation AS Level and GCSE English Language and Literature students, as well as ESL primary school pupils (who have succeeded in various official examinations, including those run by Pearson and the British Council). 

I am particularly interested in formative assessment, developing students‚Äô methodological and critical thinking skills, and supporting the gifted and talented.

Over the next 5-10 years I will continue to seek international education opportunities in Europe, ideally in a head of department role and/or as a gifted and talented coordinator.

position 2: Shakespeare & Philosophy Symposium, Garrick's Temple, Kingston-on-Thames
skills: ['Teaching', 'Research', 'Courses', 'Tutoring', 'Literature', 'Dutch', 'English', 'Coaching', 'Writing', 'Higher Education', 'Editing', 'Lecturing', 'Public Speaking', 'Translation', 'Intercultural Communication', 'Education Management', 'Language Teaching', 'Books', 'Publishing', 'Educational Leadership']
summary:
PhD / Doctorate on 24 October 2012. Radboud University Nijmegen. Title PhD thesis: 'The Rise of the Professional Author: The Life and Work of Sir Walter Besant' 
Now available via Amazon.co.uk

Apart from being a prolific author, historian, philanthropist and critic, Sir Walter Besant (1836-1901) was a major force in the professionalisation of authorship. In 1884 he founded the ‚ÄòSociety of Authors‚Äô, and six years later he launched the monthly periodical The Author, the organ of this society. Although nowadays largely forgotten or marginalised, Besant played a central role in late Victorian literary life. He was indefatigable in his campaigns for the improvement of the position of authors, but also habitually took part in the many great literary debates of his time. It should be emphasised, however, that this thesis is far more than a mere life story; it can best be described as a meta-biography: through the focus on the life of this literary figure this study describes the infrastructure of the late-Victorian literary world at a time of dramatic change. Against the backdrop of the explosively expanding book trade of the second half of the nineteenth century it studies the literary field and the relations between authors, publishers and--new on the scene--literary agents. It analyses the literary, artistic and political networks that shaped the discourses of the final two decades of the nineteenth century, thereby combining various research strategies from archival research (manuscripts and ego-documents), historical contextualisation and theoretical perspectives.

summary:
My name is Bert van Dijk. I studied business economics and marketing management and graduated from both degrees with an 8+. Additionally, I completed economic courses with an average of 8.7. Besides the regular university programs I completed, I seek to invest in myself by visiting other universities for skill or knowledge specific courses.

In june 2017 I finished two (post) Master programs to become a qualified higher level high school teacher (eerstegraads bevoegdheid) in both economics (Economie) and business economics (M&O). I enjoy working with and helping young people on the subjects which I enjoy.

My goals are:
- To sparkle enthusiasm amongst others
- To learn new things, as well as to share my own knowledge and ideas
- To keep challenging myself and my environment

Interests
I am a former board member of debating society T.D.V. Cicero (Treasurer, Dutch: Penningmeester). Debating is a skill that grants many tools to excel in clear communication and public speaking.
Whatever the subject, the critical-thinking skills and deliberative process inherent in debate are valuable for learning and personal growth.

As a board member, I was involved with multiple events. I facilitated the Dutch Debating Winter School, the Cicero-tournament and Women's Open tournament. These events attracted international attention.
I was one of the main organizers of the Groot Tilburg Scholieren Debat (GTSD). I enjoyed this specifically because it lies at the intersection of two of my interests: high school teaching and debating.

As of now I am working at a high school called 'Het Norbertusgertrudislyceum', in which I teach economics to students aged 16 - 19.

Besides that, I like being active in sports. I play football and visit the gym regularly. Next to that, I enjoy reading. I believe that reading offers great opportunity to learn and grow, as books often contain messages from people with a lifetime experience within specific fields.

summary:
++ Transformation Designer, Creative Director, Community Builder, Educator, Speaker and Moderator ++

I PRACTICE TRANSFORMATION DESIGN

Transformation design seeks to create desirable and sustainable changes in behavior and form ‚Äì of individuals, systems and organizations. It is a multi-stage, iterative process of applying design principles to large and complex systems.

In the past 20 years, I have gained broad expertise on topics such as transformation design, digital society, UX, human(ity) and life centered design. I believe in the creation of a 'global learning society' to ignite transformation towards a better world.  

CO-FOUNDER DIGITAL SOCIETY SCHOOL & GLOBAL GOALS JAM

I have co-founded and currently co-direct Digital Society School (25 staff, 100 trainees/year) within Amsterdam University of Applied Sciences. I co-initiated the widely used Design Method Toolkit, the global Design Across Cultures programme and the growing social movement of the Global Goals Jam. The latter with the United Nations Development Programme: 90+ cities and over 5000 design activists that use their creative skills for the benefit of the SDG's and society. 

EDUCATOR & ACTiVE COMMUNITY MEMBER

I am a Community Liaison for the World Design Organization, advocating life-long learning and promoting design for the SDG's. I am also a proud advisory board member for DOT in Spain and visiting professor at IE University in Madrid. 

KEYNOTE SPEAKER and MODERATOR

I have addressed and engaged diverse audiences on stages large and small around the world, such as in Spain, Sweden, Finland, Norway, Germany, UK, Chile, Mexico, the US, S. Korea, Japan, China, South Africa, Rwanda and many more. Events included: RIT Fram Chair keynote, SXSW, The Next Web (TNW), TEDxSalon Shanghai, Social Good Summit NYC, EDIT Toronto, Passiontour Chile, Industrial Design Trend Seoul, etc.

DESIGNER FOR EXPERIENCES/ EMOTIONS

In the past I have co-founded and headed a digital agency and strategic design consultancy and took seat in the board of the international Design & Emotion Society for over 10 years. I am happy to have worked with companies such as Unilever, P&G, Bic, Decathlon, KLM, Philips, Mars, ING, Pepsico and to have given crash courses and guest lectures at many universities/ organisations around the world.

Please contact me if you want to collaborate/partner up to design a better world.

name: Andries Hiskes
field of studies 1: Cultural Analysis - Comparative Literature & Literary Theory
degree 2: The School of Criticism and Theory
skills: ['Literary Theory', 'Teaching', 'Academic Writing', 'Research', 'Information Management', 'Disability Studies', 'Literary Criticism', 'Close Reading', 'Web 2.0', 'ICT', 'Knowledge Management', 'Dutch', 'Literature', 'Lecturing', 'Coaching', 'English', 'Philosophy', 'Blended Learning', 'Qualitative Research']
summary:
I'm a literary scholar/cultural theorist who enjoys working interdisciplinarily, whether it concerns the cultural and educational sectors, healthcare, or the urban environment at large. I strive to increase aesthetic and affective responsivity and develop the close-reading skills in the various settings in which I work, driven by the exchange and development of knowledge, ideas and skill sets.

As an educator, I stimulate the continuous search between thinking and working critically and creatively, in order to teach myself and the people I work with that those two qualities are closely connected. I enjoy working interculturally and internationally, as learning with and from people across different cultures is always fruitful. Curiosity lies at the basis of all my work and I aim to provoke it wherever I go.
